info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued July 02 at 10:07PM EDT until July 02 at 11:00PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: The National Weather Service in Greenville-Spartanburg has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Southeastern Cleveland County in the Piedmont of North Carolina... Northeastern Cherokee County in Upstate South Carolina... * Until 1100 PM EDT. * At 1006 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located 7 miles west of Gaffney, or near Cowpens, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to trees and power lines. * Locations impacted include... Gaffney, Blacksburg, Grover, Earl, Cherokee Falls, Draytonville, Kings Creek, Kings Mountain and Crowders Mountain State Park. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Please report damaging winds, hail, or flooding to the National Weather Service by calling toll free, 1, 800, 2 6 7, 8 1 0 1, or by posting on our Facebook page, or Tweet it using hashtag nwsgsp. Your message should describe the event and the specific location where it occurred.
